The map appears to represent the layout of a mining operation, labeled "Virginia Pocahontas Mine No 3". It features several overhead and vertical sections marked with different symbols and lines, primarily in red and blue hues.

The miner, a Caucasian male, appears to be in his mid to late 30s. He is dressed in practical mining attire: a dark, grubby work coverall and a hard hat adorned with various stickers, indicating perhaps safety certifications or union affiliations. The helmet is labeled with "W.M.L." at the front. His face shows a focused expression, suggesting deep scrutiny or decision-making about the mine layout.

title: Harold Stanley, director of safety for the Virginia-Pocahontas Coal Company, looks at a map cross-section of mine #3 at the 1,250-foot level in his office near Richlands, Virginia. He supervises a safety director at each of the six mines who in turn supervise safety directors for each mine shift.
